headline: Daughter of Charles Schwab’s Founder to Sell $18 Million of Stock
summary: The daughter of  Charles Schwab  co-chairman and founder, Charles R. Schwab, plans to sell more than $18 million of the financial-services firm’s shares.  Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz, a Schwab director since 2022, has adopted a so-called Rule 10b5-1 plan to sell 240,000 shares by Oct. 16, 2025.  The company disclosed Schwab-Pomerantz’s plan, adopted on Aug. 14, in a form it filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
